reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Casa de Estoi is simple and peaceful. The hotel is a nice place to relax, very quiet. However, it's also fairly basic. We arrived at about 8 on a Sunday and the owner had the cleaning lady open up for us. We spoke to him on the phone and he was able to arrange a taxi to take us to a local restaurant, as there doesn't seem to be any reasonable restaurants in walking distance. We didn't have a car with us and were probably a bit hampered by this as there is very little to do in Estoi.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at Casa de Estoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a simple affair served from 9-11 at a communal table and consists of cake, cereal, yogurt, orange juice, bread, ham and cheese and jam. By the end of a four day stay it felt a little repetitive.
reviews.title: Escape the bustle of city life in gorgeous Estoi

likes.disliked: — Could not have a proper shower - shower in bath

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had also booked an apartment that sleeps four, although we were only two of us. I think had we been four it could have been slightly problematic as the only other sleeping space apart from the double bed in the bedroom was a large sofa, that I think might turn into a double bed. So a family with two children might find it not quite what they were expecting.
reviews.title: Relaxed & charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we had a very pleasant and relaxing stay. The honesty bar is a nice touch and soft drinks are reasonably priced, although reflects the fact that the staff are not around much. The loungers around the plunge pool provide a pleasant place to enjoy the afternoon sun.
reviews.title: Posh and Peaceful

likes.liked: — The people, the ambience, our room and its facilities

reviews.text: What a lovely place to stay! The house is a stunning country period property and the rooms furnished with beautiful dark wood and white linens. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the service was very personal but informal - it felt like staying at a friend's house really! The surrounding areas include a palace which is being refurbished, a roman country house, tiny villages and panoramic hilltop views. At just 20mins from the airport and the beaches, golf resorts and other tourist areas it is ideal for a short break....... All this and 25 degrees in October. Go there!
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous place. Not quite up to the standards written about by other reviewers (I would imagine it was because we were out of season...we were certainly the only people in the hotel) but everything you could wish for. We were offered a choice of rooms; everything spotless and recently decorated; breakfast good but somewhat limited (stuff put out at beginning of week still there halfway through); friendly staff. Should point out that, although this is listed as 'No 1 Hotel in Faro', it isn't in Faro but in Estoi about 11km away so a car is necessary (something we didn't realise until the day before we traveled) as there isn't much in Estoi (Roman ruins and the Palace are worth a look) and, if you're in the room we were (can't remember the name but it was first door on the left at the top of the stairs) the hot water takes an age to come through.
reviews.title: Excellent Casa de Estoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure you visit Cafe Vanessa across the square. The owner, Ana is a lovely lady who took two very tired and fraught English people and told them to 'relax' which was just what we should have done and what we did! Good food, good company. And the fact that she didn't know us from Adam and trusted us to come back later and pay for the drinks we had had, rescued what had been up until then, a pretty disastrous day (thanks again Ryanair).
reviews.title: An idyllic, fabulous Casa

reviews.text: In Faro we would recommend the restaurant ATELIER DE COMIDA STO ANTONIO (see my other review).
reviews.title: Perfect place for one!

reviews.text: This fabulous casa could give any Pousada a run for the money. We stayed 2 nights in mid October and were immediately offered a choice of rooms, ending up (at no extra cost) with a suite with our own sitting room, roof terrace and private outside steps down to the courtyard (which also leads to the breakfast room) and swimming/plunge pool. Idyllic. The next day was very warm so we put off the sight-seeing to soak of the ambiance of this country house and the courtyard pool. The Casa has a well-heeled, old family charm about it - you feel as if the duquesa has just left to take the air (in her red-velvet upholstered carriage) which we had seen waiting in the courtyard area.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel near Faro center

reviews.text: After a guided tour of the house we took the air ourselves in a short walk to the Roman ruins and the next day to the gardens of the Pousada in Estoi (some of the public rooms with beautifully painted ceilings were also open to non-residents to see). We also took in the Church of St Anthony right across the road from the Casa (the bells stop at 9 pm!) and we also made sure we took in the delicious lasagne served at Vanessa's, also across the road at the foot of the stairs to St Anthony's.
reviews.title: This place is an absolute gem!

reviews.text: Amazing guesthouse !! There are beautiful clean rooms, several different formal and classy sitting areas. The breakfast was cooked hot and plenty. The salt water pool was very refreshing. The village of Estoi is small and quaint . This is not convenient is you plan to spend alot of time at the beach, although 15 min drive or 20 euro cab fare away. Only 10 minutes to Faro airport. A really unique find if you are looking for an off the grid unique guesthouse experience.
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning guesthouse. Great breakfast!

reviews.text: I stayed here at the beginning of May. From the moment I arrived I knew the hotel and the village was special. It was quiet and felt very safe. The owner made me welcome straight away. The hotel was beautiful, traditional and very clean!!
reviews.title: Portugal's hidden treasure

reviews.text: My room was very nice and spacious and the bathroom was modern and very clean!
reviews.title: Cozy, relaxed stay at an elegant casa. Amazing host.

reviews.text: The owner will go out of her way to help you and it was an absolute pleasure to stay!
reviews.title: relaxing and wonderful stay at the casa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was opposite the beautiful church and it was magical to see at night. It felt very calm and relaxing!!
reviews.title: More like a home rather than Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This historic home turned bed and breakfast hotel is on the main square of the town of Estoi, a ten minute drive north from the Faro Airport. The town has a number of summer festivals including one in late June which shows a music/dance celebration honoring one of the country’s saints. The hotel manager is absolutely charming and recommends excellent beach, food and sightseeing choices throughout the Algarve and in Lisbon (he used to live there). The family cat Chica welcomes you and the yummy breakfast in the shaded courtyard (during summer; during winter it is served in the regal dinning room) is the perfect setting for a quiet holiday. The home retains original antique furnishings, a pool table and game room. There is a small pool and a separate apartment for a group more than two. A car is recommended if traveling in the Algarve as the beaches and small towns are well worth exploring. For the price, location, setting and atmosphere this hotel is a must.
reviews.title: Don't Miss Out on this Historic Stay in Algarve
